checklist.item: Review all system interfaces from stories 1-8

worker_notes: All criteria met. BattleScene uses render::hex_prism::HexPrismGrid (not physics::collision::HexPrismGrid) since DestructionSystem and rendering need the render grid. Projectile-wall collision uses the render grid's ray_cast directly. Player-hex collision iterates the render grid with the same capsule-hex primitive. CollisionSystem::check_player_blocks works directly since it uses BuildingBlockManager.

notes_history.note: Implemented complete BattleScene. Key design decision: used render::hex_prism::HexPrismGrid as the main grid since DestructionSystem and rendering expect it. Inlined player-hex collision and projectile-wall collision logic to avoid physics grid type mismatch. All 6 criteria pass.

iteration_history.action: Created BattleScene struct with new(), update(), fire_cannon(), clear_projectiles(), generate_dynamic_mesh(), check_player_hex_collision(). Added scenes module to game/mod.rs.
iteration_history.notes: Used render HexPrismGrid; inlined collision logic to bridge grid type gap.

learnings: Two distinct HexPrismGrid types exist: render::hex_prism::HexPrismGrid and physics::collision::HexPrismGrid. The render one is the primary grid used by DestructionSystem and rendering. Both have ray_cast and iter methods with compatible semantics.
CollisionSystem is stateless (unit struct) — its methods can be inlined when type mismatches require using the render grid directly.
